node.title: NT 'thwarted again' as court rules public housing tenants entitled to 'reasonable comfort'
node.alt: An Indigenous woman stands in front of a basic dwelling.
node.description: Residents in the remote community of Santa Teresa celebrate a landmark win in a drawn-out legal fight that will set "a new legal standard" for all tenants in the NT.
node.content:
["Public housing tenants are celebrating a \"landmark\" victory\u00a0after the full bench of the Northern Territory\u00a0Supreme Court rejected a bid by the government to weaken language that required it to provide\u00a0habitable\u00a0housing.\u00a0", "Daniel Kelly\u00a0from Australian Lawyers for Remote Aboriginal Rights\u00a0said Friday's outcome set \"a new legal standard\" for all tenants in the NT.", "\"The Northern Territory government has been thwarted again\u00a0in trying to lessen those obligations,\" he said.\u00a0", "All landlords in the NT, including the government,\u00a0are now legally required to \"give [tenants] some comfort and some basis for a decent life\".", "It is a landmark decision in an ongoing\u00a0legal battle that began in\u00a02016, when 70 public housing tenants in Santa Teresa, 85km\u00a0south-east of Alice Springs, moved to sue the NT's\u00a0Department of Housing over the condition of their homes.\u00a0", "Residents reported frequently losing access to electricity, working plumbing and hot water\u00a0for months or, in some cases, years at a time.\u00a0", "One of the lead tenants in the case, Enid Young, was missing a back door on her property for five years.\u00a0", "The drawn-out legal battle saw the case move\u00a0through the NT Civil and Administrative Tribunal to the Supreme Court, where, in 2019, a judge found\u00a0that\u00a0a \"habitable\" home should be \"safe\", but also \"humane\" and \"reasonably comfortable\".\u00a0", "", "
Dan Kelly says the rights of remote tenants are\u00a0now clear.(ABC News: Michael Franchi)
", "
Opens door for more communities
", "Friday's finding in favour of the tenants followed an attempt by the government\u00a0early last year to have that language \"wound back\".", "\"The NT government has consistently argued that the obligation\u00a0they owe to remote tenants is to provide them with a house that is safe, and only safe,\" Mr Kelly said.\u00a0", "\"That argument was rejected by the Supreme Court\u00a0and it's been rejected again today by the full court.\"\u00a0", "Mr Kelly said other Santa Teresa tenants would now be able to have their cases assessed against the\u00a0new standard.\u00a0", "He said the case also\u00a0opened the door for similar class actions in the NT's other remote communities.\u00a0", "\"Hopefully this leads to other communities coming forward\u00a0and enforcing their rights through the courts \u2014 those rights are now very clear.\u00a0", "", "
Dan Kelly says the finding opens\u00a0the door for similar class actions.(ABC News: Greg Nelson)
", "
Compensation to be determined
", "The full court finding was in response to the cases of two lead litigants:\u00a0Enid Young\u00a0and Mr Conway, who died before the case was resolved.\u00a0", "In 2019, a Supreme Court justice\u00a0ordered Ms Young be compensated more than $10,000,\u00a0instead of $100 as was originally decided upon by NTCAT, for having no back door on her house from 2010 until 2016.\u00a0", "Mr Kelly said questions of further compensation for her and for other members of the original litigation remained \"unresolved\".", "While Friday's judgement dealt with the government's appeal of the 2019 decision,\u00a0Mr Kelly's team has an appeal that will consider questions of compensation in the coming months.\u00a0"]
